To test this, you can launch a constellation with `src-0.1.17-c` AMI for the simulator instance and do the following:

* press `>1` button to start simulation

* wait until `~/code/cloudsim-docker.log` prints `Done`, meaning the robot is ready. This takes around a couple of minutes.

* attach to the `gazebo_run` docker instance and start Task 1 checkpoint 1
   
        source /opt/ros/indigo/setup.bash 
        rosservice call /srcsim/finals/start_task 1 1

* move the robot to Task 1 checkpoint 1 position

        gz model -m valkyrie -x 2 -y 0 -z 1.1 -R 0 -P 0 -Y 0

* there should now be messages published to the `/srcsim/finals/task` topic , and this triggers `src_monitor.py` script to start posting to cloudsim-sim
